com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue

Interface YPMValidateCouponUE


  • public interface YPMValidateCouponUE
    User exit for validating coupon.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document validateCoupon(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YPMValidateCouponUE user exit is called whenever validateCoupon API is invoked.

    • Method Detail

      • validateCoupon

        org.w3c.dom.Document validateCoupon(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YPMValidateCouponUE user exit is called whenever validateCoupon API is invoked. The user exit is expected to return whether the coupon is valid or not along with the status of validation, for the passed input criteria.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.

        The default behavior is for the user exit to do any and all validation. A system rule exists to enable default rule validation to be performed after the user exit is invoked. The system rule is named "perform the default validation for coupons." When this rule is enabled, coupons that were returned as valid by the user exit will have the default validation logic performed on them. Additional validation will not be done for coupons that were returned as invalid from the user exit.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue.YPMValidateCouponUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The output XML contains the coupon validation status for the given input criteria.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains the coupon to be validated along with the input criteria. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML that contains the coupon validation status. The coupon is considered as a valid only if the Valid flag is set to Y. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
